page.title: 18 HAVENSTREET RAILWAY 1
page.content: The Isle Of Wight central railway company built a station in Havenstreet in 1875. This made the village prosper. The land used to belong to John Rilands, a local land owner and his initials are on the side of a workshop. After the railway closed in 1966 a preservation group called Wight Locomotive Society was formed. Steam engines from the Southern Railway and a private line in Fawley were bought or donated to the society and many original notices and buildings remain. Today the trains run every quarter of an hour each Sunday, during the summer months and Bank Holidays. In July and August they run every Thursday. It costs Â£150 a day to run because of the cost of coal.
